results.title: Gathering of the clans
results.brief_description: Scenes at the Gathering of the Clans held at Inverness in 1966. Traditional dancing, sports and the pipe band contest are shown. The history of Scottish culture as represented at the Gathering is briefly discussed.

results.title: Gateway to independence
results.brief_description: A guide dog gives independence to a blind person. Shows the careful selection and training of dogs and the training of the people who will use these dogs as aids to daily living. It stresses that complete confidence in the dog by its owner is essential for the success of the enterprise. Cinematography by Tom Cowan.

results.title: Gateway to a city
results.creator_credit: Roderick Johnston and Roderick Films International
results.brief_description: A brief history of the area near Circular Quay, Sydney, known as The Rocks. Shows how this valuable site has become a neglected backwater and indicates, by the use of models, how it will look in the near future after redevelopment.

results.title: Gardens of Japan
results.brief_description: Some of the scenic beauty of Japan - in nature and in the highly cultivated and famous gardens in Tokyo and Kyoto; a variety of gardens which have been planned and cultivated to please both the mind and the eye, including those using sand and stone to represent natural landscapes and which have symbolic signifance. A short sequence shows the traditional tea ceremony. A revised version of Title Codes 004193 and 004194.

results.title: Game hunting in the Arctic Regions (D)
results.brief_description: A silent documentary film with English subtitles, about an arctic sea voyage and game hunting in the north of Norway, and around Spitzbergen and Bear Island. WARNING: CONTAINS IMAGES OF DYING ANIMALS, BUTCHERING CARCASES AND CAGING WHICH MAY DISTURB SOME VIEWERS.

results.title: Gallipoli: a virtual tour (MAC & PC)
results.brief_description: A highly visual interactive document on the First World War Gallipoli campaign. Containing hundreds of images, documents, music and various footage from 1915 makes this virtual tour ideal for schools. This CD-ROM is broken up into various historical aspects and is set up to play on both PC and Mac computers - all you need is a web browser such as Internet Explorer or Netscape. For PC users, Internet Explorer 5 can be installed from the CD.

results.title: Gala presentation and crowning of Miss Australia 1970
results.brief_description: A record of the Miss Australia Charity Quest of 1970 held in Adelaide. The state finalists are presented and interviewed before the crowning of Rhonda Ifland from NSW assisted by Miss Australia 1969, Susan McCellard. Hosted by Maggie Tabberer and Geoff McComas. Guests include: South Australian premier Steel Hall; and Bernard Dowd representing Hickory, the event sponsors. Hickory commercials are interspersed throughout the film.

results.title: Future looks rosy
results.brief_description: Looks at the problems of soil salinity due to erosion and poor agricultural practices. In cooperation with the Department of Conservation, Forests & Land, landholders are seeking solutions to the problem of land degradation.

results.title: Furnishing is fun
results.brief_description: How an average family in 1961, whose children have grown up, refurnishes the home. Shows the range of furnishings available in Australia, the advisory services, especially colour consultants and gives some indication of costs involved. Narrated by Gordon Bell and scripted by Burton Graham.
